title: The Watchers
key_events: Dr. Okonkwo conducts individual assessment with Adrian
She reveals backstory: son with early-onset Alzheimer's at 19
Son believed his disease was transcendence, died without recognizing her
Colonel Reeves interviews Adrian about signal discovery
Reeves reveals trauma: 2025 Djibouti bioweapon attack
His entire 37-person unit died, he survived alone
Reeves explains containment contingencies, including termination
Three incompatible perspectives on the Change established

character_development.Dr. Marie Okonkwo: Full backstory revealed - son's Alzheimer's drives her to find cure, sees Changed as patients losing themselves like her son did
character_development.Colonel Reeves: Bioweapon trauma revealed - survivor guilt and determination never to wait too long again, sees Changed as contagion
character_development.Adrian: Recognizes manipulation, questions own judgment, caught between perspectives

planted_elements: Marie's son who forgot her - pays off in Ch52 when she realizes cure would be like lobotomy
Reeves' bioweapon trauma and survivor guilt - leads to his actions in Ch27 and Ch56
The parallel between disease and transcendence as indistinguishable
transformation_stage: Stage 1 progressing - emotional responses becoming theoretical, recognition of own flatness
cosmic_horror_elements: Trauma creating pattern recognition in observers
The impossibility of objective judgment when inside transformation
Three valid perspectives all leading to different conclusions
The question of truth becoming meaningless
themes: The impossibility of saving those who don't want saving
